intro: Memora racemosa, commonly known as the clustered memora, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are often woody and branched. Memora racemosa thrives in moist, sunny habitats and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
